title: How to Create a Questionnaire in Word (for Windows and Mac)

steps.title: Open Word and make sure the developer tab is visible.
steps.content: Open Word and make sure the developer tab is visible. You'll find this program in your Start menu. If you don't see the developer tab, go to File > Options > Customize Ribbon > Developer (under Main Tabs) .

steps.title: Create a new document or choose a template.
steps.content: Create a new document or choose a template. Go to File > New and, if you want a template, search "Forms" in the "Search online templates" text field.

steps.title: Insert a text control.
steps.content: Insert a text control. If you want to add a block or line of text, you'll want to add a text control. Go to Developer > Rich Text Content Control or Developer > Plain Text Content Control .

steps.title: Add a date picker.
steps.content: Add a date picker. If you want whoever is filling out the questionnaire to be able to pick a date on a calendar, go to Developer > Date Picker Content Control .

steps.title: Insert a checkbox.
steps.content: Insert a checkbox. Go to Developer > Check Box Content Control . You can add almost any sort of question and answer form from the Developer tab. Experiment with the types of questions and answers you can add to the questionnaire, then change or set their properties from Developer > Properties . steps.title: Open Word and make sure the developer tab is visible.
steps.content: Open Word and make sure the developer tab is visible. You'll find this program in the Applications folder in Finder. If you don't see the developer tab, go to Preferences > Ribbon and Toolbar > Customize the Ribbon > Main Tabs > Developer . [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Create a new document or choose a template.
steps.content: Create a new document or choose a template. Go to File > New or New from Template and search "Forms" for the questionnaire template you want to use.

steps.title: Add content controls to your form.
steps.content: Add content controls to your form. From the Developer tab, you'll be able to insert text boxes, check boxes, and combo boxes. Repeat this step to add as many content controls as you need to.

steps.title: Change or set the options for each content control.
steps.content: Change or set the options for each content control. Click to select a content control, then select Options to be able to set them. You can set common properties like Add Help Text to give hints at each field or set specific properties, like Drop-down enabled to let the user make selections from the menu.
